title: Rally in Tobacco Stocks Could Burn Out Fast
sub_head: A revaluation of cigarette companies probably has more to do with hedge-fund positioning than long-term investors’ conviction in their shift to smokeless products
body:
Tobacco stocks are fashionable again, but investors’ taste for nicotine may not last.
In this year’s rocky markets, the U.S.-listed shares of cigarette producers Philip Morris International and Altria have risen 14% and 6%, respectively, making tobacco the fourth biggest gainer among the S&P 500 index’s more than 60 subsectors. London-listed Lucky Strike owner British American Tobacco has fared even better, up more than a fifth.
